DataElement.preferredName: Patient Hemorrhage Pre-Existing Condition Eligibility Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to the pre-existing condition of bleeding or escape of blood from a vessel.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the pre-existing condition of bleeding or escape of blood from a vessel.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Bleeding or escape of blood from a vessel.:A health condition or medical problem that was diagnosed or treated before a specific date.

Concepts.definition: The flow of blood from a ruptured blood vessel.
A health condition or medical problem that was diagnosed or treated before a specific date.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have active
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have active bleeding or pathologic conditions that carry high risk of bleeding such as known bleeding disorder, coagulopathy or tumor involving major vessels?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Evidence or history of bleeding diathesis (greater than normal risk of bleeding) or coagulopathy (in the absence of therapeutic anticoagulation), any hemorrhage/bleeding event >Grade 3 <=4 weeks prior to randomization. Patients with full-dose anticoagulants are eligible provided the patient has been on a stable dose, at least 2 weeks, of low molecular weight heparin or warfarin and has an INR range 2-3. Aspirin doses >325 daily are not allowed.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have any known bleeding diathesis or coagulopathy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Evidence of bleeding diathesis (greater than normal risk of bleeding) or coagulopathy (in the absence of therapeutic anticoagulation)

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of clinically significant bleeding risk

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have evidence of an acute intracranial or intratumor hemorrhage on CT or MRI

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have history of a significant bleeding disorder

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have active bleeding?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC 1302
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have evidence of significant intracranial hemorrhage?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF_Text_7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have evidence or history of bleeding diathesis or any hemorrhage or bleeding event >= CTCAE Grade 3 within 4 weeks prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have evidence of bleeding diathesis or clinically significant coagulopathy

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC-1602 Question
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of bleeding diathesis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of greater than or equal to Grade 2 CNS hemorrhage or history of any CNS hemorrhage within 28 days of study entry?
